bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 84 (Tuesday, May 17, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. BOURDEAUX:H.R. 7796.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8[Page H5098]

item.title: James M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

summary.text:
Lake Lanier and Upper Chattahoochee Safety Act

This bill requires the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) to review potential threats to human life and safety from the use of recreational areas at Buford Dam, Lake Sidney Lanier in northern Georgia. The bill also requires USACE to install technology necessary to alert the public of hazardous water conditions or to minimize or eliminate threats to human life and safety (e.g., sirens, strobe lights, and signage).

USACE operates and maintains Buford Dam which forms Lake Sidney Lanier. The Chattahoochee River flows just below the dam. Water releases from the dam effect water levels in Lake Sidney Lanier and river flow conditions below Buford Dam.

bill.title: Lake Lanier and Upper Chattahoochee Safety Act

item.title: Lake Lanier and Upper Chattahoochee Safety Act
Lake Lanier and Upper Chattahoochee Safety Act
To direct the Corps of Engineers to carry out a review of recreational hazards at Buford Dam, Lake Sidney Lanier, Georgia, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
